label: A_hR12_166_2h-001
title: $\alpha$-B (R-12) Structure
comments:
This is a metastable phase of boron, also known as rhombohedral-12 boron (Donohue, 1982).  It is the simplest known phase (the ground state, $\beta$-B, has 105 atoms in the primitive cell). 
 Note the relationship between the icosahedra in this structure, \href{current_web_home_dir/A_hR105_166_ac9h4i-001}{$\beta$-B} and \href{current_web_home_dir/A_tP50_134_a2m2n-001}{T-50 B}. 
 Hexagonal settings for rhombohedral structures can be obtained with the option {\tt --hex}.
